docTitle.titlePart:
Analysis of Concatenation and Packing Mechanisms
in IEEE 802.11n

byline.docAuthor: Dionysios Skordoulis, Qiang Ni, Usman Ali & Marios Hadjinicolaou

byline.affiliation:
Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering,
School of Engineering and Design,
Brunel University,

front.div:
Abstractâ€”The IEEE 802.11 wireless LAN current standardiza-
tion struggles to comprehend with emerging bandwidth-thirsty
applications and services. For that reason, a pristine Task Group
was initiated, known as TGn, in order to form a new amendment
that will offer higher efficiency and throughputs of more than
100 Mbps, as measured at the MAC data service access point. To
achieve this goal, key PHY and MAC enhancements have been
proposed within the latest standard draft. This paper investigates
the throughput limits that existing techniques comprise, mainly
because of PHY/MAC overhead and it describes TGn's proposed
frame aggregation enhancements. Our simulation results con-
firms that the A-MSDU, A-MPDU and a combination of these
two can improve extensively the channel efficiency and the data
throughput and finally concludes with a comparison analysis
between these innovative frame aggregation mechanisms.
